H0.text: Minerals they contain is the factor used to group igneous rocks, besides crystal size.

H1.text: By shapes, igneous rocks are grouped besides the size of their crystals.

H2.text: Impurities they contain are how igneous rocks are grouped besides the size of their crystals.

H3.text: By color, igneous rocks are grouped in addition to being grouped by the size of their crystals.

A4.text: Two important variables used for the classification of igneous rocks are particle size, which largely depends on the cooling history, and the mineral composition of the rock.

A5.text: All other minerals present are regarded as nonessential in almost all igneous rocks and are called accessory minerals.
